instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.D6990: What is D6990? Diode sitting between PPBUS_G3H/PP18V5 charger voltage and PP3V42_G3H power supply input, can die and cause PP3V42_G3H to be missing and have no input voltage. .
definitions.C6990: What is C6990? Capacitor to ground on input to PP3V42_G3H power supply. PP3V42_G3H power supply turns 18.5v from charger or 8.5v-12.5v PPBUS_G3H from the battery into PP3V42_G3H. This capacitor can short to ground and keep PP3V42_G3H from turning on which would keep the machine from having a light on the magsafe charger.

threads.title: Another 802-2915-B
threads.message:
Drink spill,
Wasnt to bad inside, Bit of muck around L8920 / <TRANSISTOR>Q8950</TRANSISTOR> area so cleaned that up with IPA ,.

Have no power no lights at all on magsafe, and only reading .205v on F6905. So not getting much of any reading on anything else,. its like no power is getting to the board, 

Using known good dc in board and Apple 85w magsafe,

Doing a visual inspection I noticed that <DIODE>D6990</DIODE> was burnt out, I've replaced that now but it's made no difference.
 Am i pissing in the wind with this one or is it fixable?

threads.title: Another 802-2915-B
threads.message:
Possibly input leakage detected by original charger.
Did you test with fake charger, or lab PSU?

Post exact values of <RESISTOR>R7080</RESISTOR>/81 and <RESISTOR>R7085</RESISTOR>/86 (measured onboard, ohm scale).

threads.title: Another 802-2915-B
threads.message:
tried fake charger, same deal. 

<RESISTOR>R7080</RESISTOR> = 50k
R70801= 35.2k

<RESISTOR>R7085</RESISTOR> = .230mh
<RESISTOR>R7086</RESISTOR> =145k

threads.title: Another 802-2915-B
threads.message:
Do you mean still no voltage on F6905?
Is the fuse good?

Change <TRANSISTOR>Q7080</TRANSISTOR>; resistors value look bad.

threads.title: Another 802-2915-B
threads.message:
Still onl;y .205v ob either side of F6905 and fuse is good, It feels like a short is bringing down the volatge as soon as I connect magsafe, 

As the wife is about to drag me out the door to go and watch bloody disney on ice I havent had time to change <TRANSISTOR>Q7080</TRANSISTOR> yet ill do that later butjust having a quick probe I noticed that <CAPACITOR>C6990</CAPACITOR> is shorting to ground on both sides, if that helps?

threads.title: Another 802-2915-B
threads.message:
Remove <CAPACITOR>C6990</CAPACITOR> and check for short on board again.
If still short, change <CHIP>U6990</CHIP>.
Don't touch <TRANSISTOR>Q7080</TRANSISTOR> yet...

threads.title: Another 802-2915-B
threads.message:
Removed <CAPACITOR>C6990</CAPACITOR> and wow! Not sure if it was the corrosion or something had burnt out here but the board was a complete mess underneath layers of the PCB corroded and traces destroyed, 

Guy dosent want to pay to have this repaired so ive thrown it onto the donor pile!,. Might have a go at repairing the traces if I get the time,.
